intro: Vernonia gerrardii, commonly known as ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the United States. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in various soil conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its rugged appearance. Vernonia gerrardii is often found in prairies, open woods, and along roadsides, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
